data.name: Currency
desc: Symbols, names, and attributes of a specific currency, returned in a sequence by XLocaleData.getAllCurrencies().

items.name: BankSymbol
lines: Currency abbreviation used by banks and in money exchange, for example, EUR or USD.
This usually should be identical to the ISO 4217 currency code also used in the ID, but doesn't necessarily have to be.

items.name: DecimalPlaces
lines: The number of decimal places, for example, 2 for US Dollar or 0 for Italian Lira.

items.name: Default
lines: If this currency is the default currency for a given locale.

items.name: ID
lines: ISO 4217 currency code identifier, for example, EUR or USD.

items.name: Name
lines: Name of the currency, for example, Euro or US Dollar.

items.name: UsedInCompatibleFormatCodes
lines: If this currency is the one used in compatible number format codes with FormatElement.formatIndex() values in the range 12..17.
Those format codes are used to generate some old style currency format codes for compatibility with StarOffice5 and StarOffice4.
